alert.note: Alert for Henry; Rock Island; Whiteside (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued January 03 at 4:45AM CST until further notice by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...The Flood Watch is extended for the following rivers in Illinois... Rock River near Joslin affecting Rock Island, Whiteside and Henry IL Counties. .Rainfall from last night through this morning, combined with ice action may produce flooding on the Rock River near Joslin by mid week. At this time, there is limited confidence associated with exact rainfall amounts, extent of run-off, and location of predicted rainfall. Ice action may also be a factor in alternating river levels. As the forecast becomes more certain, this watch will either be upgraded to a flood warning or cancelled. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding is possible. * WHERE...Rock River near Joslin. * WHEN...From Wednesday afternoon until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 13.0 feet, Flooding of unprotected agricultural land occurs. Water also affects Lundeens Landing Campground. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:45 AM CST Tuesday the stage was 11.5 feet. - Forecast...Flood stage may be reached tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 12.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: If you are in the watch area, remain alert to possible flooding. Residents and those with interests near the river should monitor rising water levels and be prepared for possible flood warnings. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/quadcities. The next statement will be issued later this morning.
